title: PlayStation 5 Event Delayed - Kinda Funny Games Daily 06.02.20
description:
Blessing is joined by Spawn On Me's Kahlief Adams to discuss the delayed PS5 event and more. 

FOLLOW KAHLIEF ADAMS:
https://twitter.com/Kahjahkins
https://twitter.com/spawnonme
https://twitch.tv/spawnonme
https://www.youtube.com/spawnonme
https://www.patreon.com/spawnonme

Time Stamps - 
 00:14:22 - Housekeeping
The great big Kinda Funny Core stream is THIS Thursday! Manticore Games will join us on twitch.tv/kindafunnygames to announce the winners of the Kinda Funny Game Jam prizes! Andy and Greg will then hang out and play the winning games. You can enter now at kindafunny.com/gamejam
The Kinda Funny Games Showcase is back, but it’s called the Guerilla Collective! As you know, we’ve teamed up with our friends at the Media Indie Exchange to do a three-day showcase featuring nearly 90 games! It all kicks off Saturday at 10 am PT on twitch.tv/guerrillacollective!
Thank you to our Patreon Producers: Mohammed Mohammed, Conner Nolan, Black Jack
The Roper Report   -
00:15:14 - They did it. This week’s PS5 event has been postponed
From @PlayStation on Twitter
00:21:08 - Should EA and CDPR cancel their events next week? - Best Friends Q:Scott
00:27:20 - Speaking of delays, Call of Duty is delaying their new seasons - Adam Bankhurst @ IGN
00:35:31 - The Last of Us Part 2 has around 60 different accessibility features - Rebekah Valentine @ GiBiz
00:43:38 - WWE 2K22 is looking at Smackdown and No Mercy for inspiration - Andy Robinson @ Video Games Chronicle
00:48:28 - Out today
00:52:00 -  Reader mail   -
00:55:00 - We've seen a number of gaming companies publicly share their support for the black community and acknowledging the magnitude of the moment we are in. There has been a noticeable exception though—Nintendo - Daisy
01:02:01 - Torbannok(PS4) - Torbannok
01:0315: - Shout-out: Who is a black voice in the industry that you want to highlight and give a shout-out
01:05:00 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s Hosts:
Blessing and Gabe Patillo from Married to the Games
